functions.name: equal
functions.doc: Equal will check if two values are equal. This function will result in a fatal error if the assertion is incorrect.

functions.name: noError
functions.doc: NoError will check if the passed value is a starlark.NoneType, if not it will error out the script.  This function may cause a fatal error if the assertion is incorrect.

functions.name: openFile
functions.doc: OpenFile that was packed into the compiled binary. The resulting file does not support many operations such as Chown, Write, etc. but you may read it's contents or copy it to another file i.e. one opened by ssh or sys.

functions.name: drop
functions.doc: Drop will take a given file, copy it to disk, optionaly set the permissions move it to a given destination, and clean up the temp file created. The default perms are '0755'.

functions.name: require
functions.doc: Require will be used in the init function for the worker to specify which files you wish to include in the asset bundle which will be accessible on the target. Will fatal if error occurs.

functions.name: openFile
functions.doc: OpenFile stored on the CDN. Writing to the file will cause an upload to the CDN, overwriting any previously stored contents. Reading the file will download it from the CDN. Since operations are performed lazily, openFile will never error however reading from or writing to the file may.

functions.name: move
functions.doc: Move a file to the desired location.

functions.name: close
functions.doc: Close a file if possible, otherwise this operation is a no-op.

functions.name: name
functions.doc: Name returns file's basename.

functions.name: content
functions.doc: Content returns the file's content.

functions.name: write
functions.doc: Write sets the file's content.

functions.name: copy
functions.doc: Copy the file's content into another file.

functions.name: remove
functions.doc: Remove the file. It will become unuseable after calling this operation.

functions.name: chown
functions.doc: Chown modifies the file's ownership metadata. Passing an empty string for either the username or group parameter will result in a no-op. For example, file.chown(f, '', 'new_group') will change the file's group ownership to 'new_group' but will not affect the file's user ownership.

functions.name: chmod
functions.doc: Chmod modifies the file's permission metadata. The strong passed is expected to be an octal representation of what os.FileMode you wish to set file to have.

functions.name: newRequest
functions.doc: NewRequest creates a new Request object to be passed around.

functions.name: setMethod
functions.doc: SetMethod sets the http method on the request object.

functions.name: setHeader
functions.doc: SetHeader sets the http header to the value passed on the request object.

functions.name: setBody
functions.doc: SetBody sets the http body to the value passed on the request object.

functions.name: exec
functions.doc: Exec sends the passed request object.

functions.name: kill
functions.doc: Kill a process (using SIGKILL).

functions.name: name
functions.doc: Name gets the name of the passed process.

functions.name: replace
functions.doc: Replace uses the golang regex lib to replace all occurences of the pattern in the old string into the new strong.

functions.name: setUser
functions.doc: SetUser sets the RemoteUser attribute to be used in the outgoing SSH Connection. WARNING: MUST BE CALLED BEFORE OTHER SSH CALLS TO WORK.

functions.name: exec
functions.doc: Exec a command on the remote system using an underlying ssh session.

functions.name: openFile
functions.doc: OpenFile on the remote system using SFTP over SSH. The file is created if it does not yet exist.

functions.name: getRemoteHost
functions.doc: GetRemoteHost will return the remote host being used by the worker to connect to.

functions.name: openFile
functions.doc: OpenFile uses os.Open to Open a file.

functions.name: detectOS
functions.doc: DetectOS uses the GOOS variable to determine the OS.

functions.name: exec
functions.doc: Exec uses the os/exec.command to execute the passed executable/params.

functions.name: connections
functions.doc: Connections uses the gopsutil/net to get all connections created by a process (or all by default).

functions.name: processes
functions.doc: Processes uses the gopsutil/process to get all processes.

functions.name: files
functions.doc: Files uses the ioutil.ReadDir to get all files in a given path.

functions.name: IP
functions.doc: IP returns the primary IP address.

functions.name: OS
functions.doc: OS returns the operating system.

functions.name: isLinux
functions.doc: IsLinux returns true if the operating system is linux.

functions.name: isWindows
functions.doc: IsWindows returns true if the operating system is windows.

functions.name: uid
functions.doc: UID returns the current user id. If not found, an empty string is returned.

functions.name: user
functions.doc: User returns the current username. If not found, an empty string is returned.

functions.name: time
functions.doc: Time returns the current number of seconds since the unix epoch.

functions.name: rand
functions.doc: Rand returns a random int. Not cryptographically secure.

functions.name: generateKey
functions.doc: GenerateKey creates a new Key object to be passed around.

functions.name: encrypt
functions.doc: Encrypt takes a Key and some data and returns the AESGCM encrypted IV+ciphertext.

functions.name: decrypt
functions.doc: Decrypt takes a Key and AESGCM encrypted IV+ciphertext data and returns the plaintext.
